snippet: The husband-and-wife team running the restaurant in Corona hid shipments of cocaine as part of a ring that stretched from Costa Rica to Italy, the authorities said.
abstract: Federal authorities say Gregorio and Eleonora Gigliotti, who ran pizzeria in Corona, Queens, hid shipments of cocaine in refrigerated cargo containers and then distributed it New York and Italy; say international operation ring reached from Costa Rica to Italy.

byline.original: By STEPHANIE CLIFFORD and ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
byline.contributor: Stephanie Clifford reported from New York, and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome.

lead_paragraph: The husband-and-wife team running the restaurant in Corona hid shipments of cocaine as part of a ring that stretched from Costa Rica to Italy, the authorities said.

headline.main: Queens Pizzeria Owners Charged in Cocaine Smuggling Operation
headline.print_headline: Pizzeria Owners Accused of Cocaine Trafficking

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Cucino a Modo Mio (Queens, NY, Restaurant)
